title: [BUG] <title>Microsoft.Maui.Controls"
body:
### Description

Skia sharp is not compatible with the latest version of Microsoft.Maui.Controls"

### Code

The best way to share code for larger projects is a link to a GitHub repository: https://github.com/user/repo/tree/bug-123

But, you can also share a short block of code here:
```cs

```
You can also share some XAML:

> Note: You can give me feedback by 👍 or 👎 this comment.

comments.author: airtaxi
comments.body: This might be the cause: [https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/pull/2584](https://github.com/CommunityToolkit/Maui/pull/2584). It seems that as the internal signature of the `AddLogicalChild` method has changed, issues are also occurring in other packages.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: @siamaksh1367 could you provide more info as an error or exception?

comments.author: sish-siameh
comments.body: Currently, if I want to use the latest version of Microsoft.Maui.Controls (9.0.50) along with the latest SkiaSharp, it's not possible. SkiaSharp requires Microsoft.Maui.Controls to be downgraded to 9.0.0, which in turn forces the rest of the application to downgrade as well, since many other NuGet packages and libraries depend on it.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: How does a downgrade get forced? SkiaSharp just references the .NET 8 versions of MAUI, so if you have later versions, then the later versions will be used.

comments.author: molesmoke
comments.body:
I'm using the latest MAUI and SkiaSharp together just fine. Seems more likely to be a problem with your package references rather than a SkiaSharp bug:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/concepts/dependency-resolution#direct-dependency-wins
